statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Kentucky 68, Mississippi 58
article.story: OXFORD, Miss. (AP) -- Joe Crawford scored 23 points and Randolph Morris added 14 points and 10 rebounds as Kentucky defeated Mississippi 68-58 on Saturday in both team's Southeastern Conference opener. Kentucky (12-3, 1-0) extended its winning streak to eight games, limiting Ole Miss to two baskets in the final 12 minutes while wiping out a 53-51 deficit. Ramel Bradley added 13 points and five assists for the Wildcats. Todd Abernethy led Ole Miss (11-4, 0-1) with 17 points while Dwayne Curtis had 13 points and 10 rebounds. Clarence Sanders added 12. The Rebels managed 2-of-13 from the field in the final 12 minutes, breaking open a tight contest. Ole Miss finished 22-of-57 from the field and only 4-of-17 from 3-point range. Kentucky made 56 percent of its shots after coming off a season-low shooting performance Wednesday in a win over Houston. The Wildcats were 10-of-18 from the field in the second half, led by Crawford, who was 5-of-5. Ole Miss led 37-35 at halftime. Neither team led by more than four points in the first 20 minutes. The Rebels went on an 8-0 run to take a 53-51 lead with 12:02 left. Kentucky dominated defensively the rest of the way, allowing only a pair of Abernethy jumpers. Bradley sparked the strong finish by the Wildcats, scoring eight straight points in a 17-5 run. Jodie Meeks hit a 3-pointer in the surge that gave Kentucky a 56-53 with 8:56 left. The teams were tied or swapped leads 20 times.
